definition: to take an indirect route/to waste one's time by using an inappropriate method
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: The biggest challenge is to stay on track & not allow yourself to be side-tracked.
sentences.chinese: 最大的挑战是要保持正确的方向，不走弯路。

sentences.english: I do not want you to make detours, remember those lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我不想让你再走弯路，切记那些教训。

sentences.english: Around 75% say the country is on the wrong track.
sentences.chinese: 大约有75%的美国人认为国家正在走弯路。

sentences.english: This can avoid detours on the study.
sentences.chinese: 由此可以避免学习上走弯路。

sentences.english: This is why you were born. To take that road less traveled and forge a path for others.
sentences.chinese: 这就是你的天命，直达目的少走弯路，引领革命。

sentences.english: Acording to walking little curved road, many, fast, good and economical, there is doubtlessly the important function .
sentences.chinese: 这对于少走弯路，多快好省，无疑有重要作用。

sentences.english: Avoid zigzags in preparation,and reduce the waste of investment.
sentences.chinese: 避免筹建期间走弯路，减少投资的浪费。

sentences.english: Moreover, clearing objectives can avoid detours.
sentences.chinese: 此外，明确目标可以少走弯路。

sentences.english: Not surprisingly they're less sinuated, less frustrated and less angry.
sentences.chinese: 很自然地，他们会少走弯路，不再沮丧或愤怒。

definition: winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
fork in a road/wrong road
pointless trip/not worth the trip
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
shortcut
to be taken advantage of
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to wade across the river, feeling for footholds as one goes (idiom)/to advance cautiously, step by step/to feel one's way forward
pinyin: mo1 zhe5 shi2 tou5 guo4 he2

definition: (abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
see 邪道[xie2 dao4]
to follow blindly/to conform slavishly/unthinking obedience
blind/blindly/ignorant/lacking understanding
mistaken ideas/misconceptions/the error of one's ways
twice the effort for half the result
to turn back/to backtrack/(fig.) to revert to the former way of doing things
